remarks: A set of outer measure zero is measurable.  The term "outer measure zero" here is slightly different from "nullset/negligible set"; a nullset has ` vol* ( A ) = 0 ` while "outer measure zero" means that for any ` x ` there is a ` y ` containing ` A ` with volume less than ` x ` .  Assuming AC, these notions are equivalent (because the intersection of all such ` y ` is a nullset) but in ZF this is a strictly weaker notion.  Proposition 563Gb of [Fremlin5] p. 193. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Mar-2015.)
statement:
nulmbl2 $p |- ( A. x e. RR+ E. y e. dom vol ( A C_ y /\ ( vol* ` y ) <_ x ) -> A e. dom vol ) $.
$d A x y $.
$d x y $.
